sec.p: Future changes in climate for Burrishoole for 2071–2100 include an increase in air temperature in all seasons and changes in the seasonal distribution of precipitation ( figure 3). The projected increase in January air temperatures ranges from 0.9°C to 3.1°C while increases for spring are expected to be between 1.2°C and 3.3°C. Precipitation in January is projected to increase by between 25 per cent and 58 per cent while in contrast August should be drier with decreases ranging from 4 per cent to 62 per cent. Increases in water temperature of between 0.8°C and 2.3°C are projected for January, while those for spring (March, April and May) range from 0.8°C and 2.4°C.

div.p: ( a) Mean daily air temperature and ( b) precipitation at Burrishoole for a control period (1968–1997, grey line with filled diamond) and for a future climate period (2071–2100) for four GCM–RCM scenario combinations namely the E A2 (ECHAM 4 GCM and A2 SRES emission scenarios) and H B2 (HadA3 GCM and B2 SRES emission scenarios). Solid line, H A2; dashed line, H B2; solid line with square, E A2; dashed line with square, E B2.
